item.title: Amy add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "The world is big and I want to have a good look at it before it gets dark." -- John Muir

item.title: Amy add a quote by Alan Shapiro
item.description: "...all works of nonfiction, or memoir, have to first and foremost be art before they can be true. They have to be artful first before they can be truthful....If you emphasize the truth-telling at the expense of art, nobody is going to be interested in it. And if you sacrifice truth in the name of art, you risk triviality. There's a constant balance between those two. " -- Alan Shapiro

item.title: Amy add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Amy add a quote by Jeffrey Eugenides
item.description: "We felt the imprisonment of being a girl, the way it made your mind active and dreamy, and how you ended up knowing which colors went together. We knew that the girls were our twins, that we all existed in space like animals with identical skins, and that they knew everything about us though we couldn’t fathom them at all. We knew, finally, that the girls were really women in disguise, that they understood love and even death, and that our job was merely to create the noise that seemed to fascinate them." -- Jeffrey Eugenides

item.title: Amy add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "What I know of spirit is astir in the world. The god I have always expected to appear at the woods' edge, beckoning, I have always expected to be a great relisher of this world, its good grown immortal in his mind." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Amy add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "The Satisfactions of the Mad Farmer...the quiet in the woods of a summer morning, the voice of a pewee passing through it like a tight silver wire; ..." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "If people persist in trespassing upon the grizzlies' territory, we must accept the fact that the grizzlies, from time to time, will harvest a few trespassers." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Amy add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "One final paragraph of advice: do not burn yourselves out. Be as I am - a reluctant enthusiast....a part-time crusader, a half-hearted fanatic. Save the other half of yourselves and your lives for pleasure and adventure. It is not enough to fight for the land; it is even more important to enjoy it. While you can. While it’s still here. So get out there and hunt and fish and mess around with your friends, ramble out yonder and explore the forests, climb the mountains, bag the peaks, run the rivers, breathe deep of that yet sweet and lucid air, sit quietly for a while and contemplate the precious stillness, the lovely, mysterious, and awesome space. Enjoy yourselves, keep your brain in your head and your head firmly attached to the body, the body active and alive, and I promise you this much; I promise you this one sweet victory over our enemies, over those desk-bound men and women with their hearts in a safe deposit box, and their eyes hypnotized by desk calculators. I promise you this; You will outlive the bastards." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Amy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do one thing every day that scares you." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Amy add a quote by Carolyn G. Heilbrun
item.description: "We women have lived too much with closure: "If he notices me, if I marry him, if I get into college, if I get this work accepted, if I get this job" -- there always seems to loom the possibility of something being over, settled, sweeping clear the way for contentment. This is the delusion of a passive life. When the hope for closure is abandoned, when there is an end to fantasy, adventure for women will begin." -- Carolyn G. Heilbrun

item.title: Amy add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "Activism is my rent for living on the planet." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Amy add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "Was I the only woman in the world who, at my age - and after a lifetime of quite rampant independence - still did not quite feel grown up?" -- Dodie Smith

item.title: Amy add a quote by Carol Shields
item.description: "Eventually, everything gets stuck between a pair of parentheses or buried in the bottom of a trunk." -- Carol Shields

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world." -- John Muir

item.title: Amy add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "One touch of nature makes the whole world kin." -- John Muir

item.title: Amy add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "Don't own so much clutter that you will be relieved to see your house catch fire." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Amy add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "There are, it seems, two muses: the Muse of Inspiration, who gives us inarticulate visions and desires, and the Muse of Realization, who returns again and again to say "It is yet more difficult than you thought." This is the muse of form. It may be then that form serves us best when it works as an obstruction, to baffle us and deflect our intended course. It may be that when we no longer know what to do, we have come to our real work and when we no longer know which way to go, we have begun our real journey. The mind that is not baffled is not employed. The impeded stream is the one that sings." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Amy add a quote by Scott Russell Sanders
item.description: "A good book appeals to what is best in us...." -- Scott Russell Sanders

item.title: Amy add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Amy add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "Whether we and our politicians know it or not, Nature is party to all our deals and decisions, and she has more votes, a longer memory, and a sterner sense of justice than we do." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Amy add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "Eating is an agricultural act." -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Amy add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Amy add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "The plain state of being human is dramatic enough for anyone; you don't need to be a heroin addict or a performance poet to experience extremity. You just have to love someone." -- Nick Hornby
